{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553512,"name":"Olympians","username":"OlympiansRobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T00:15:57.375Z","cooked":"

Code Link to Github, descriptions list errors.

We’re having some issues with our code when it comes to 2 issues mainly:

1 - DriveBase errors - Generally speaking the error states that it cannot find button 3 on the Xbox controller on Port 0, the issues are documented in the dslogs attached.

2 - Looking for Clarification on the functionality of CommandXboxController and how it differs with XboxController so we can use the trigger command and understand how to implement it better and make sure we structure it’s code/usage properly. We’re unsure if it’s something to do with the safety mechanisms.

Overall seeking assistance. (sigh)

image1919×1079 273 KB

OlympiansRobotics:

1 - DriveBase errors - Generally speaking the error states that it cannot find button 3 on the Xbox controller on Port 0, the issues are documented in the dslogs attached.

Is the controller connected? Does it show in the DS and when u press th button does it show?

OlympiansRobotics:

2 - Looking for Clarification on the functionality of CommandXboxController and how it differs with XboxController so we can use the trigger command and understand how to implement it better and make sure we structure it’s code/usage properly. We’re unsure if it’s something to do with the safety mechanisms.

The regular controller class just returns Boolean for whether a button is pressed or not? The Command XBox controller returns triggers for each button that u can bind to commands. If using command based programming, definitely use this.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Binding Commands to Triggers

Apart from autonomous commands, which are scheduled at the start of the autonomous period, and default commands, which are automatically scheduled whenever their subsystem is not currently in-use, ...

Thank you so much for the quick response! Yes, the controllers (both driver port 0 and operator port 1) are plugged in and the deriver’s station shows reactions to them both, but the robot has no reaction and we get this error message, or another saying PWM/DIO 3 is already in use. That is the first motor controller port declared in our drive, so I think that is involved.
We are using Command Based (under the impression this is a more reliable option) but could switch from CommandXboxController if that might help, since it is new to us and in previous years we used XboxController without trouble. An earlier incarnation of our code was Timed Robot based and used the regular XboxController but still the drive didn’t work. We can definitely rebuild our code, but we were under the impression Command based was more reliable.
Much appreciated!
The Olympians Team 9300

Can u post a link to ur code?

OlympiansRobotics:

saying PWM/DIO 3 is already in use. That is the first motor controller port declared in our drive, so I think that is involved.

This would seem to be indicating that ur declaring a motor or object with the same PWM port multiple times which is bad.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T19:42:21.805Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":13.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495076,"topic_slug":"coding-difficulties-olympians-9300-tankdrive-drive-base","display_username":"Olympians","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28614,"username":"legoguy1000","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67883,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/coding-difficulties-olympians-9300-tankdrive-drive-base/495076/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554465,"name":"","username":"AMysterium","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amysterium/{size}/167374_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T20:57:18.233Z","cooked":"

Button 3 on an Xbox Controller is the x button, which you are trying to bind to. Thats probably why you are getting some warning, likely a controller issue. It’s a weird thing to get though, and my first question is are you sure you are using a standard xbox controller?

But, that shouldn’t explain not being able to drive otherwise with the joysticks. The code looks fine at a glance, so I’m wondering if the issue might be mechanical.

Regardless, here’s how I would identifty the problem. You’ve said that the joysticks seem to reporting fine in Driver Station. Next, I’d validate that you are reading those values in robot code. Simplest way is just print statements in your tank drive function imo. Make sure those are non-zero.

Next, let’s make sure that your motors are moving. I’d just rewrite the tankDrive function to do .setVoltage on the motors.

Probably one of these two steps will not work, and there will lie your issue to debug.

Feel free to have a mentor/adult PM me if you’d like to go back and forth and diagnose the issue.

We are using a Logitech controller (Amazon.com: Logitech G F310 Wired Gamepad Controller Console Like Layout 4 Switch D-Pad PC - Blue/Black) and I checked that it is switched to the Xbox setting. We have been using them for the last two years, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t the problem… We aren’t sure how to add the print statements, do we need to use java.io.PrintStream?
Thanks!

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T21:49:16.055Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":29,"readers_count":28,"score":10.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495076,"topic_slug":"coding-difficulties-olympians-9300-tankdrive-drive-base","display_username":"Olympians","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-940-000110-Gamepad-F310/dp/B003VAHYQY","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com: Logitech G F310 Wired Gamepad Controller Console Like Layout 4 Switch D-Pad PC - Blue/Black","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46476,"username":"AMysterium","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amysterium/{size}/167374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67883,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/coding-difficulties-olympians-9300-tankdrive-drive-base/495076/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3554513,"name":"Nigel","username":"Nigelientje","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nigelientje/{size}/209408_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T21:56:35.717Z","cooked":"

You can use System.out.println("some text or value");

I would advise to add it inside the lambda function of your default drive command and print the value of your joystick. This way, you can get the most information.

I can think of 3 different cases:

  1. nothing shows up in your console. In this case, your command isn’t being (re)run for some reason.
  2. something keeps printing but the value doesn’t change. In this case you might need to switch your controller inputs from a double to a DoubleSupplier.
  3. the correct values are being printed constantly. In this case it is most likely an electronics or mechanical issue.
